result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason R Powell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: Bail applied to Costs/DNA Surcharge. Paid in full.  Remainder of bail to be refunded to poster.
Defendant is not to possess any weapons/firearms.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Disclose to any physician in writing your conditions of probation and provide a copy to your Agent.  Sign Medical Release for Agent.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

No contact with Tara Herbert or any stores listed in criminal complaints from cases 16CM858, 16CF556, 15CM1138, 16CF736, 15CF507, 16CM1112 and 16CF893.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

from NOVA
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Jason R Powell in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #2.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #2.  Count #1 is dismissed and read in.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Hartley makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following:  Count #2. 

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

3 1/2 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 0 days )

18 months of Initial Confinement
24 months of Extended Supervision

Term of Probation: 3 Years

Conditions of Probation / extended supervision:

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
	
No contact with Tara Herbert or any stores listed in criminal complaints from case #'s 16CM858, 16CF556, 15CM1138, 16CF736, 15CF507, 16CM1112, 16CF893.
	
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;

Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;

No Use or Possession of illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;

Disclose to any physician in writing your conditions of probation and provide a copy to your Agent. 

Sign Medical Release for Agent;

Defendant is not to possess any weapons/firearms.

COSTS:  $268.00 Bail to be applied from this case, and case #16CF893.  

DNA Surcharge: $250.00 Bail to be applied from Case #16CF893

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program

Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
